title: Jose Mourinho in sly dig at successor Solskjaer as Roy Keane admits 'he needs to get some results
text:
Former United midfielder Roy Keane added that United results need to improve

Mourinho criticised Solskjaer for speaking 'all the time about the future'

Former Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho has aimed a sly dig at his successor Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, stating that the Norwegian speaks 'all the time about the future'.

Solskjaer took charge of United, initially on a caretaker basis, in December 2018 following the departure of Mourinho.

Despite an encouraging start, United have struggled of late and have gone three games without a win in all competitions, while they went into the clash at home to Liverpool in 14th place in the Premier League.

Jose Mourinho has criticised Ole Gunnar Solskjaer for speaking 'all the time about the future'

Mourinho accused Solskjaer of doing 'good PR' in the build-up to the game against Liverpool.

Speaking on Sky Sports, Mourinho said: 'They did some good PR in the week to make it absolutely clear or create positive atmosphere for the game. I'm going to try and get a job like Ole has, and speak all the time about the future.

'I think it's a great situation, three year contract – the future, the young players. I think it's a great job to do in such a giant club.'

Mourinho accused United of doing 'some good PR' in the build-up to the clash with Liverpool

Former United midfielder Roy Keane admitted that Solskjaer desperately needs positive results.

Keane said: 'He needs some results. It's great when you talk about having a plan, they need some results. He's got to get more out of the players he got.

'Ole needs to get more out of this group of players. If you're not winning, the pressure builds. His record has not been good enough, and it needs to improve fast.'

Many of United's performances so far this season have been underwhelming, with speculation growing about Solskjaer's future at the club.

United won just two of their first nine Premier League games this season.
